Topics.Title: User Analytics
Topics.Content:
User Analytics

Access the User Analytics dashboard to view performance metrics for material handlers.

Available Metrics

  • Total Tx (Transactions): Total number of inventory movements within the date range.
  • Total Qty (Quantity): Sum of all quantities moved.
  • Unique Parts: Number of distinct Part IDs handled.
  • Rapid Fire: Count of transactions occurring less than 10 seconds apart for the same part.
  • Quality Score: Overall performance rating based on transaction accuracy and speed.

Accessing Analytics

  1. Navigate to Visual > Visual User Analytics.
  2. Select a date range using the date pickers.
  3. Click Load Data to view metrics.

Topics.Title: Data Visualization
Topics.Content:
Data Visualization

The application uses various charts to visualize data trends.

Chart Types

  • Bar Charts: Compare quantities across different categories (e.g., transactions per user).
  • Line Charts: Show trends over time (e.g., inventory levels over the last 30 days).
  • Pie Charts: Display distribution of data (e.g., inventory by item type).

Interactivity

Hover over chart elements to see exact values. Click on legend items to toggle data series visibility.

Topics.Title: Exporting and Printing
Topics.Summary: Export data to Excel or print reports.
Topics.Content:
Exporting and Printing

Most grids in the application support exporting to Excel and printing.

Export to Excel

  1. Right-click on any data grid.
  2. Select Export to Excel from the context menu.
  3. Choose a save location for the .xlsx file.
  4. The export includes all visible columns with current filters applied.

Print

  1. Right-click on a data grid.
  2. Select Print.
  3. Configure print settings (page range, orientation, etc.).
  4. Click Print to send to printer.

Note: Hidden columns are not included in exports or prints.
